arts.ttl: Tomoki Iwata makes Birmingham City vow with laser focus on one clear target
arts.sum: Asked for his targets, Iwata sang from the same hymn sheet as Tom Wagner, Garry Cook, Davies and Co when he said: “Only one thing, promotion to the Premier League.” Tomoki Iwata has set his sights firmly on reaching the Premier League with Birmingham City.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies reveals what he won’t stop doing after another Birmingham City win
arts.sum: Chris Davies will not stop celebrating with Birmingham City’s fans after fist-pumping the away end for the fourth time this season. After equalling Blues’ wins tally on the road for the whole of last season, Davies was in jubilant mood and approached the away end for the now customary celebrations.

arts.ttl: Tomoki Iwata on target as Birmingham beat Rotherham for fifth straight win
Birmingham City set to be without six players for Rotherham clash
arts.sum: Blues will also be without Ethan Laird and Luke Harris after the pair suffered ankle injuries in the win over Wigan Athletic before the international break. Lee Buchanan is closer to a return after two months out with a calf injury.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies makes Iwata transfer admission after making Birmingham City stars uncomfortable
arts.sum: The performances of Paik and Iwata against Wrexham make it nigh-on impossible for Davies to overlook them at Rotherham. Taylor Gardner-Hickman – a 22-year-old midfielder with almost 100 Championship games under his belt – played at right-back.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies clarifies Birmingham City’s structure with two new coaches
arts.sum: Ex-England international Huddlestone only retired in the summer after a two-year spell with Manchester United, where he performed a player-coach role for their under-21 side. “Ashley Cole has left to join England so we’ve recruited Tom. He was a top class player in his time.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City agree compensation package as defender completes transfer
arts.sum: Browne turned down the offer of a new contract at St Andrew’s @ Knighthead Park to pursue first team football elsewhere and has been snapped up by the Saddlers. Central defender Browne enjoyed a loan spell at Walsall-based Rushall Olympic last season, appearing 18 times for the Pics alongside Saddlers midfielder Ronan Maher.
